summary: User asks how to cache data (like authentication headers) between multiple interceptors in the workflow context, similar to thread-local storage in Java. The issue involves using local activities in interceptors to authenticate values and pass them to other interceptors.
userImpact: Users cannot easily share cached data like authentication headers across multiple interceptors in workflow context, requiring workarounds or complex context management.
rootCause: AsyncLocalStorage from @temporalio/workflow may not work properly when instantiated outside the standard SDK patterns, causing errors when used across multiple interceptors.
proposedFix: SDK could provide built-in support for context-local caching in interceptors, or clarify the proper pattern for sharing state across interceptors similar to Java's thread-local storage.
workaround: Copy and export a custom ContextManager instance based on SDK's internal context-manager.ts, using AsyncLocalStorage from @temporalio/workflow to manage context.
resolutionDetails: Discussion indicates continuation-local-storage is outdated and AsyncLocalStorage has limitations in workflow context. Users are directed to implement custom solutions based on SDK patterns.
keyQuote: continuation-local-storage is outdated so I would not use it at all and in any case it will not work from the workflow context.
